abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Third National
            Community Empowerment Program in Rural Areas (PNPM Rural
            III) Project is to reduce poverty and improve local-level
            governance in Indonesia through the provision of investment
            resources to support productive proposals developed by
            communities, using a participatory planning process. There
            are four particularly important concerns in how the project
            approaches indigenous communities: (i) developing
            dissemination and facilitation materials in collaboration
            with local communities (issues of language, graphics, etc);
            (ii) using appropriate, inclusive self decision-making
            mechanisms in environments where indigenous groups are
            politically and culturally marginalized; (i.e. the Papua
            Program); (iii) finding a balance so that groups (i.e.
            women) excluded from traditional institutions can also join
            project processes; and (iv) since Kecamatan Development
            Program (KDP), the project included several adaptations to
            address concerns that marginalized indigenous groups are
            especially vulnerable to problems of elite domination and
            corruption (by recruiting and training of facilitators from
            these communities, providing special logistical support for
            geographically and socially difficult area, having two
            village facilitators (a man and a woman) trained and
            mentored to allow them to gradually in charge for village
            meetings under PNPM rural planning and accountability
            meetings, village proposal writing team and village
            implementation committee comprise village elected team, etc).
